data.title: Jeff Gordon Online Kids Zone
data.text:
Welcome to the Kids Zone. Here you'll find games and other things of interest for kids. Though adults might be entertained by some of the things here as well.

Tic Tac Toe

The popular game with a Jeff Gordon theme Jeff Gordon Maze

Print out the maze and lead Jeff Gordon to the NASCAR title.

Red, Blue, Green, and Yellow race to the finish

**Games require Macromedia Shockwave installed**

Please note that some games in the above panel are "PG-rated"

(though no worse than anything found in a local arcade)

Math Quiz (Answers at bottom of the page)

1. If Jeff Gordon averages 150 miles per hour, how long will it take him to complete a 500 mile race?

2. One lap around Daytona International Speedway is 2.5 miles long. Jeff Gordon finished 7.5 miles ahead of Tony Stewart. How many laps did Gordon finish ahead of Stewart?

3. Jeff Gordon takes the green flag at Michigan Speedway with 21 gallons of fuel. Let's say he averages 6 miles per gallon. One lap around Michigan Speedway is 2 miles long. On what lap will Jeff run out of gas?

4. Use the driver's car numbers to come out with the total:

Marcos Ambrose (9) + Brad Keselowski (2) + Kevin Harvick (29) + Joey Logano (20).

Take the total of those drivers. Divide the total by 10.

Take that number and multiply it by Robby Gordon (7).

Subtract that total by Kyle Busch (18). What number do you have?

Geographical Facts

--Jeff Gordon races in 36 NASCAR races during the year.

--He races in 19 different states-- most often in North Carolina (5 times), which includes an exhibition race.

--Seven races are held within 250 miles of Charlotte, North Carolina where most of the race teams are located.

--Nine races are held west of the Mississippi River (twoin California, one in Nevada, two in Arizona, two in Texas, and two in Kansas).

--The farthest track from Jeff's home in North Carolina is Infineon Raceway in Sonoma, California.

--The largest crowd to see Jeff race is at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway.

--Homestead-Miami Speedway in Homestead, Florida is the southernmost race on Jeff's schedule.

--The farthest north he races is New Hampshire International Speedway in Loudon, New Hampshire.

--Jeff was born in Vallejo, California which is located about an hour north of San Francisco. He grew up in Pittsboro, Indiana which is located just west of Indianapolis. He currently splits his time between New York City and North Carolina.

Answers to the math quiz:

1. Three hours, twenty minutes

2. Three laps

3. Lap 64

4. Twenty four

Jeff Gordon Online

Caricature of Jeff Gordon was done by Mike Smith of the Las Vegas Sun.
